tooltips.money_made_lost:
üí∞ ACTUAL MONEY GAINED/LOST

 Did I make money?

 How it works:
 (Ending - Beginning - Money Added) √∑ Total Invested

 Example:
 Started 11k z≈Ç, added 142k z≈Ç, ended 152k z≈Ç
 = Lost 1.9k z≈Ç on 153k total = -1.2%

 Includes FX? YES - USD stocks lose value if PLN strengthens

 Why it differs: Cares about HOW MUCH money you had at different times. Adding 140k before a drop = bigger loss.
tooltips.pick_quality:
üéØ STOCK PICKING SKILL (HYPOTHETICAL)

 Were my stock picks good (ignoring when I bought)?

 How it works:
 Imagine 100 z≈Ç invested at START of period
 Each day: grows/shrinks by your portfolio's daily %
 ASSUMES you bought all stocks on day 1 (not actual dates)

 Example (YTD):
 100 z≈Ç on Jan 1
 Day 1: +4% ‚Üí 104 z≈Ç
 Day 2: -2% ‚Üí 101.92 z≈Ç
 ...
 Dec 14: 123.87 z≈Ç = +23.87%

 HYPOTHETICAL? YES - not your actual money, just a measurement tool

 Includes FX? YES - PLN strengthening = USD stocks lose PLN value

 Why can be positive when you lost money:
 Treats every day equally. 10 months up (small capital) outweighs 1 month down (large capital).
tooltips.strategy_quality:
üìä OVERALL STRATEGY (HYPOTHETICAL)

 Was my strategy good (including keeping cash)?

 How it works:
 (Avg % Cash √ó 0%) + (Avg % Stocks √ó Pick Quality)
 ASSUMES all purchases happened at period start

 Example:
 70% cash + 30% stocks at +24%
 = 30% √ó 24% = +7.2%

 HYPOTHETICAL? YES - same 100 z≈Ç concept

 Includes FX? YES - stocks and foreign cash both include FX

 Why POSITIVE when you LOST money:
 Measures strategy quality over TIME, not dollars. Like a fund manager's skill rating vs your account balance. Good strategies can lose money with bad timing.
tooltips.personal_return:
üè¶ YOUR PERSONAL IRR (ACTUAL)

 What was my return considering WHEN I invested?

 How it works:
 Interest rate that produces your exact results
 PUNISHES bad timing, REWARDS good timing

 Example:
 Added 140k on Nov 16
 Value dropped 5%by Dec 14
 That entire 140k sat through the drop

 ACTUAL? YES - uses your real amounts and dates

 Includes FX? YES - all holdings in PLN

 Why it's usually worst:
 Hard to time perfectly! Most add money when they have it (often after gains = high prices). This is NORMAL.

wyckoff.how_it_works_intro: The scanner analyzes stocks using 5 observable criteria, each scored 0-100%. You can customize the importance (weight) of each criterion below.
wyckoff.criterion1_desc: Looks for horizontal price consolidation within 5-20% range width. Counts support/resistance touches. Longer duration = higher score.
wyckoff.criterion1_example: Example: "Trading range of 8.3% over 47 days with 6 support touches"
wyckoff.criterion2_desc: Declining volume = bullish (supply drying up). Higher volume on down days = accumulation (smart money absorbing). Detects volume spikes at support.
wyckoff.criterion2_example: Example: "Volume declined 23%, 1.4x higher on down days (absorption evident)"
wyckoff.criterion3_desc: Detects brief drops below support followed by quick recovery. Classic "shakeout" before markup (Phase C). High score if detected, 0 if not.
wyckoff.criterion3_example: Example: "Spring detected: dropped to $42.10, recovered to $44.50"
wyckoff.criterion4_desc: Multiple successful tests of support. Higher lows on each test = strength building. Declining volume on tests = less selling pressure.
wyckoff.criterion4_example: Example: "4 tests showing higher lows (+2.3%), declining volume"
wyckoff.criterion5_desc: Wide-spread up days on high volume. Breaking above resistance temporarily shows demand entering.
wyckoff.criterion5_example: Example: "2 wide-spread up days approaching resistance"
wyckoff.overall_score_desc: The weighted average of all 5 criteria determines the overall score (0-100%). Weights must sum to 100%. Adjust them below based on what matters most to your strategy.
wyckoff.tip2: The scanner looks at the last 60 days within your window for the "recent range"
wyckoff.tip3: Check the narrative in results - it tells you the actual consolidation duration

break_even_point.how_it_works_title: How the Break Even Point Scanner Works
break_even_point.how_it_works_intro: This scanner identifies companies that are transitioning from loss-making to profitability. It focuses on turnaround candidates by comparing recent performance against the previous fiscal year.
break_even_point.criterion1_desc: The company must have reported a Net Loss in its last full official Annual Report. This ensures we are targeting true turnaround stories, not companies that are already consistently profitable.
break_even_point.criterion2_desc: The company's performance over the Trailing 12 Months (TTM) must be better than the last full year. We calculate TTM by summing the Net Income of the last 4 quarters.
break_even_point.criterion2_formula: Current TTM Net Income > Last Annual Net Income
break_even_point.criterion3_desc: The company is now operating close to the break-even point. We calculate the TTM Net Margin and check if it falls within your specified threshold (e.g., +/- 5%).
break_even_point.criterion3_formula: TTM Margin = (TTM Net Income / TTM Revenue) * 100
break_even_point.strategy_tip_desc: Candidates found by this scan are often at a pivotal moment. Look for improved efficiency or revenue growth driving the narrowing loss.
